Package com.janeirodigital.shapetrees.client.core

Interface ShapeTreeClient

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    HttpShapeTreeClient
    public interface ShapeTreeClient
    This interface defines a proposed API to be used for any client-side implementations of a shape tree client

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Method Detail

      • discoverShapeTree

        Optional<ShapeTreeManager> discoverShapeTree​(ShapeTreeContext context,
                                             URL targetResource)
                                      throws ShapeTreeException
        Shape Trees, §4.1: This operation is used by a client-side agent to discover any shape trees associated with a given resource. If URL is a managed resource, the associated Shape Tree Manager will be returned. https://shapetrees.org/TR/specification/#discover
        Parameters:
        context - ShapeTreeContext that would be used for authentication purposes
        targetResource - The URL of the target resource for shape tree discovery
        Returns:
        A ShapeTreeManager associated with targetResource
        Throws:
        ShapeTreeException - ShapeTreeException

      • plantShapeTree

        DocumentResponse plantShapeTree​(ShapeTreeContext context,
                                URL targetResource,
                                URL targetShapeTree,
                                URL focusNode)
                         throws ShapeTreeException
        Shape Trees, §4.2: This operation marks an existing resource as being managed by one or more shape trees, by associating a shape tree manager with the resource, and turning it into a managed resource. If the resource is already managed, the associated shape tree manager will be updated with another shape tree assignment for the planted shape tree. If the resource is a container that already contains existing resources, this operation will perform a depth first traversal through the containment hierarchy, validating and assigning as it works its way back up to the target resource of this operation. https://shapetrees.org/TR/specification/#plant-shapetree Plants one or more shape trees at a given container
        Parameters:
        context - ShapeTreeContext that would be used for authentication purposes
        targetResource - The URL of the resource to plant on
        targetShapeTree - A URL representing the shape tree to plant for targetResource
        focusNode - An optional URL representing the target subject within targetResource used for shape validation
        Returns:
        DocumentResponse containing status and response headers/attributes
        Throws:
        ShapeTreeException - ShapeTreeException

      • unplantShapeTree

        DocumentResponse unplantShapeTree​(ShapeTreeContext context,
                                  URL targetResource,
                                  URL targetShapeTree)
                           throws ShapeTreeException
        Shape Trees, §4.3: This operation unassigns a planted root shape tree from a root shape tree instance. If the root shape tree instance is a managed container, it will also unassign contained resources. If there are no remaining shape trees managing the resource, it would no longer be considered as managed. https://shapetrees.org/TR/specification/#unplant-shapetree
        Parameters:
        context - ShapeTreeContext that would be used for authentication purposes
        targetResource - URL of target resource to unplant shape tree from
        targetShapeTree - URL of shape tree being unplanted
        Throws:
        ShapeTreeException

      • postManagedInstance

        DocumentResponse postManagedInstance​(ShapeTreeContext context,
                                     URL parentContainer,
                                     List<URL> focusNodes,
                                     List<URL> targetShapeTrees,
                                     String proposedName,
                                     Boolean isContainer,
                                     String bodyString,
                                     String contentType)
                              throws ShapeTreeException
        Creates a resource via HTTP POST that has been validated against the provided shape tree
        Parameters:
        context - ShapeTreeContext that would be used for authentication purposes
        parentContainer - The container the created resource should be created within
        focusNodes - One or more nodes/subjects to use as the focus for shape validation
        targetShapeTrees - One or more target shape trees the resource should be validated by
        proposedName - Proposed resource name (aka Slug) for the resulting resource
        isContainer - Specifies whether the newly created resource should be created as a container or not
        bodyString - String representation of body of the created resource
        contentType - Content type to parse the bodyString parameter as
        Returns:
        DocumentResponse containing status and response headers/attributes
        Throws:
        ShapeTreeException - ShapeTreeException

      • putManagedInstance

        DocumentResponse putManagedInstance​(ShapeTreeContext context,
                                    URL targetResource,
                                    List<URL> focusNodes,
                                    List<URL> targetShapeTrees,
                                    Boolean isContainer,
                                    String bodyString,
                                    String contentType)
                             throws ShapeTreeException
        Creates a resource via HTTP PUT that has been validated against the provided target shape tree
        Parameters:
        context - ShapeTreeContext that would be used for authentication purposes
        targetResource - The target resource to be created or updated
        focusNodes - One or more nodes/subjects to use as the focus for shape validation
        targetShapeTrees - The shape trees that a proposed resource to be created should be validated against
        isContainer - Specifies whether a newly created resource should be created as a container or not
        bodyString - String representation of the body of the resource to create or update
        contentType - Content type to parse the bodyString parameter as
        Returns:
        DocumentResponse containing status and response header / attributes
        Throws:
        ShapeTreeException

      • putManagedInstance

        DocumentResponse putManagedInstance​(ShapeTreeContext context,
                                    URL targetResource,
                                    List<URL> focusNodes,
                                    String bodyString,
                                    String contentType)
                             throws ShapeTreeException
        Updates a resource via HTTP PUT that has been validated against an associated shape tree
        Parameters:
        context - ShapeTreeContext that would be used for authentication purposes
        targetResource - The target resource to be created or updated
        focusNodes - One or more nodes/subjects to use as the focus for shape validation
        bodyString - String representation of the body of the resource to create or update
        contentType - Content type to parse the bodyString parameter as
        Returns:
        DocumentResponse containing status and response header / attributes
        Throws:
        ShapeTreeException

      • patchManagedInstance

        DocumentResponse patchManagedInstance​(ShapeTreeContext context,
                                      URL targetResource,
                                      List<URL> focusNodes,
                                      String patchString)
                               throws ShapeTreeException
        Updates a resource via HTTP PATCH that has been validated against an associated shape tree
        Parameters:
        context - ShapeTreeContext that would be used for authentication purposes
        targetResource - The target resource to be created or updated
        focusNodes - One or more nodes/subjects to use as the focus for shape validation
        patchString - SPARQL Update statement to use in patching the resource
        Returns:
        DocumentResponse containing status and response header / attributes
        Throws:
        ShapeTreeException

      • deleteManagedInstance

        DocumentResponse deleteManagedInstance​(ShapeTreeContext context,
                                       URL resourceUrl)
                                throws ShapeTreeException
        Deletes an existing resource. Provided as a convenience - no validation is performed
        Parameters:
        context - ShapeTreeContext that would be used for authentication purposes
        resourceUrl - The URL of the resource being deleted
        Returns:
        DocumentResponse containing status and response headers/attributes
        Throws:
        ShapeTreeException - ShapeTreeException

      • isShapeTreeValidationSkipped

        boolean isShapeTreeValidationSkipped()
        Indicates whether validation is currently being applied on the client
        Returns:
        boolean of whether client-side validation is being performed

      • skipShapeTreeValidation

        void skipShapeTreeValidation​(boolean skipValidation)
        Determines whether validation should be performed on the client
        Parameters:
        skipValidation - boolean indicating whether validation should be performed on the client
